@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=412030.msg3042322#msg3042322 date=1259204158]

It is logical simply because of the vast majority of people that agree with it. Like the vast majority of people who think killing and stealing is wrong. What is the logically valid argument against killing and stealing?
[/quote]

The fact that the vast majority is against killing and stealing is not the reason why killing and stealing is wrong. Killing and stealing is wrong because it affects society negatively, if people did not agree that it was wrong and did not have an implied agreement about this society simply could not function due to the constant murders or the constant fear of murder. It’s wrong because it infringes on the rights, and liberties of others, you know, treat people as you want to be treated etc.

Even if it was the case that killing and stealing were only wrong because the majority think it is, that does not make your argument any less fallacious.[/quote]

Going by your argument.

Gay marriage is wrong because it affects society negatively, if people did not agree that it was wrong and did not have an implied agreement about this (majority of people think it’s wrong? back to my point…) society simply could not function as well as it does now because of the ability to marry whomever and whatever you like, receiving all the legal benefits that marriage bestows upon it’s partners. If you allow gay marriage, why not allow a single man to marry as many woman as he likes, or a woman to do the same, and then allow 15 people to file joint taxes etc etc.

Basically all of our laws, rules, and guidelines of society stem from the beliefs of the people. And again, judging by votes of the people of this country on the issue, marriage between two people of the same sex is still wrong and not wanted.
